The number of CDC staff in China decreas: indicating a reduction in oversight capacity.
The exact numbers provided by Biden were: but his overall point about reduced oversight was supported by the CDC's data.
The CDC: s program in China responsible for spotting new infectious diseases went from having four American staff in 2017 to none by 2019.
The Global Health Protection program: which plays a crucial role in training disease detectives and responding to outbreaks, experienced the largest reduction in U.S. staff, going from four Americans and 10 Chinese staff to no Americans and five Chinese.
